block.p: REUNION INDUSTRIES, Pittsburgh, a machine parts and products manufacturing company, is selling its Irish plastics unit, Data Packaging, to an undisclosed Irish corporation for about $13.4 million.
REUNION INDUSTRIES, Pittsburgh, a machine parts and products manufacturing company, is selling its Irish plastics unit, Data Packaging, to an undisclosed Irish corporation for about $13.4 million.

K-TEL INTERNATIONAL, Minneapolis, a recorded-music seller, said it was told by the Nasdaq market that the company's stock would be delisted because its market value was short of the market's requirements.
RSL COMMUNICATIONS, Hamilton, Bermuda, a telephone and data-communications company, said it would move its main office to London from New York this month.
NOVA CHEMICALS, Calgary, Alberta, said it planned to raise its stock buyback program, which began in February and ends next February, to eight million shares from five million.
